Clay masks: Clay masks are a great alternative to traditional face washes and can be made from natural ingredients like clay, water, and essential oils. To make a clay mask, mix the clay and water to form a paste, apply it to the face, and let it dry for 10-15 minutes before rinsing off. Clay masks can help to detoxify the skin, reduce inflammation, and unclog pores.

Herbal teas: Herbal teas are a natural and soothing way to maintain personal grooming habits. Different herbs have different benefits for the skin, such as chamomile for calming and soothing the skin, and green tea for its antioxidant properties. To make an herbal tea face mask, steep a teabag in hot water, let it cool, and apply it to the face as a mask.

Sugar and olive oil scrub: Sugar and olive oil are both natural exfoliants that can help to remove dead skin cells and improve skin texture. To make a sugar and olive oil scrub, mix equal parts sugar and olive oil, massage it onto the skin in circular motions, and rinse off with warm water. This scrub can be used on the face, body, and hair to maintain a healthy and radiant complexion.

DIY toners: Toners are an essential part of any skincare routine, but commercial toners can be expensive and contain harsh chemicals. To make a natural toner, mix equal parts witch hazel and rosewater, and apply it to the skin with a cotton pad. Witch hazel has antibacterial and anti-inflammatory properties, while rosewater can help to balance the skin's pH and reduce the appearance of pores.

Coconut oil pulling: Coconut oil pulling is a natural detoxifying method that can help to remove toxins and bacteria from the mouth. To perform coconut oil pulling, take a tablespoon of coconut oil and swish it around in the mouth for 10-15 minutes before spitting it out. Coconut oil has antibacterial properties that can help to reduce bad breath, whiten teeth, and improve gum
